Text: Child care policy is economic policy. The lack of affordable options is forcing parents to drop out of the labor force, and that's making it difficult for businesses that need workers. #CareCantWait https://t.co/geREhtEaeE

Big Oil has been waging a decades-long disinformation campaign to cover up the damage they‚Äôre doing to our planet. @RepRaulGrijalva and I want answers from the public relations firms that are enabling oil and gas companies to deceive the American people.

https://t.co/Y6ODy7xo4f

I'm proud of our casework team, which works tirelessly to cut through red tape and get Orange County families answers from federal agencies. As of this week, we've returned $7+ million to members of our community.

Learn more about how we can help ‚¨áÔ∏è
https://t.co/66x4hYC5vK

My family and I recently visited the Manzanar internment camp, one of the sites where Japanese Americans were unjustly imprisoned during World War II. This space reminds us of the urgent need to stand up against hate, and how the fight for justice is ongoing. #DayOfRemembrance https://t.co/DlL1dzId5A

Salespeople at defense contractors (looking at you, TransDigm) have literally bragged about lying to the federal government in order to line their pockets with taxpayer dollars. These corporations need to be held accountable. (3/3)
https://t.co/ciIER9wJco

Defense contractors routinely abuse taxpayers. @LockheedMartin lobbied for COVID relief funds‚Äîeven though 1) profits were through the roof, and 2) the corporation still hadn't paid back the millions it owed for selling the U.S. military faulty parts. (2/3)
https://t.co/voeewBqteu

Consolidation in the defense industry enables price-gouging at the expense of taxpayers and makes it easy for these corporations to evade responsibility. I will continue to stand up for competition and accountability. (1/3)
https://t.co/EfzaBiYp5m

Orange County is an innovation hub. I recently met with two @UCIrvine grads whose OC-based small business is helping people regain mobility after brain injuries through games that can be played at home. In Congress, I'll keep fighting for resources for our researchers. https://t.co/h9ev4HIBEg

Members of Congress have a duty to hold the Administration accountable, regardless of who is in the White House. I'm glad the Administration is taking action to better protect people with disabilities, but more must be done to keep these Americans safe.

https://t.co/lX1My3vlLs

The White House is currently distributing N95 masks from the Strategic National Stockpile, but millions of people with disabilities can't safely or easily travel to pick up locations. I'm urging the Administration to change course and ship masks to these Americans directly ‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/Ptq1JU108V

It's common sense to prioritize the removal of spent nuclear fuel from regions that have high populations and are prone to earthquakes. I'm proud to join my colleagues, led by @RepMikeLevin, in this effort to keep Southern Californians safe.
https://t.co/2oF98MFC0z

Banning top government officials from trading stocks is an important step to weed out corruption‚Äîbut we also need to crack down on lawmakers who use their power to get federal grants, loans, and contracts. @gillibrandny and my bill, the STOCK Act 2.0, would expose this abuse. https://t.co/jvS9p2goBD

Americans with disabilities need protections, especially during a pandemic. I have been calling for stronger safeguards against discrimination in health care, so I‚Äôm glad the Administration is taking this step.
https://t.co/1hERUUE5cL

I proudly helped bring the @HolocaustMuseum's Americans and the Holocaust exhibit to Orange County, which is on display at @UCIrvine through March 9. At the recent virtual opening event, I spoke about the importance of choosing action over inaction. https://t.co/ZJCEYj8yBV

Some big businesses deliberately underemploy workers and pay them less, in order to boost their profits. The Part-Time Worker Bill of Rights Act, which I've introduced with @janschakowsky, @SenWarren, and @rosadelauro, will crack down on this corporate abuse.

With new reports about how polluters' misinformation tactics may have evolved, we must redouble our work to hold oil companies and their enablers accountable. I am proud to lead this effort with @NRDems Chair @RepRaulGrijalva. https://t.co/FW57Jshl95

Our state's year-round fire threats and heat advisories in the middle of February are no coincidences. They are concrete harms of the climate crisis. I will keep pushing for climate action, to protect California families. https://t.co/ncKyjGcqMW

When the big banks cheat Americans, they should face consequences. @SenWarren and I will not let @WellsFargo get away with gaming the system. We're getting answers on whether the responsible watchdog is up to the task. https://t.co/y1b8F04SVP

Since my first year in office, I have been investigating the contractors responsible for retrieving organs from donors. I'm glad the Biden Administration is taking this on, and I look forward to working with them to save lives. https://t.co/YuNxyu9Kh6

The Administration is currently considering improvements to our organ transplant system. I'm pushing for protections that would help patients of color, HIV-positive patients, and patients with disabilities; crack down on waste and fraud from contractors; and save lives. https://t.co/EhorKndGyV

Since September, I have been calling for a presidential appointee to lead these negotiations. We need to address this impasse quickly, and in a way that reflects President Biden's commitments to diplomacy, countering China, and racial justice. https://t.co/Gp5jjg38RP
Reminder: you can sign up for emergency alerts at https://t.co/UjDppDkyOj. I have! https://t.co/fJ0RQLXJC1

Californians know firsthand how worsening wildfires fueled by the climate crisis are making us sick. By investing in global health, we can keep Americans safe.

I'm excited to talk about this and more on Friday with @RepJudyChu and experts from @USCGlobalHealth. RSVP üëá https://t.co/CdKbsCA6m4

By strengthening disclosure requirements for top government officials who receive federal loans, grants, and contracts, and by banning Congressmembers and others from trading stocks, we can restore faith in government. Learn more about the STOCK Act 2.0 ‚¨áÔ∏è
https://t.co/sxuitF3yS9

The American people deserve to have confidence that their government is working for them. I'm pleased House leadership is open to updating the STOCK Act to ban members from trading stocks, but @gillibrandny and my bill, the STOCK Act 2.0, goes even further to root out corruption. https://t.co/vPkp5Ts9jv

As a member of @OversightDems, I've championed @USPS and its vital work for our communities. Today, I joined my House colleagues in passing bipartisan legislation that will stabilize the agency's financials and improve accountability, reliability, and transparency.

California is at the forefront of advancing environmental justice and protecting those historically left behind. I asked a climate justice advocate about CA's success, and he stressed how vital it is that community organizations led by people of color have seats at the table ‚¨á https://t.co/QVL89vDbhL

Legal traps known as forced arbitration agreements cut workers off from the justice system. Today, I proudly voted for legislation that will make it easier for survivors of sexual harassment and assault to hold abusers accountable. #EndForcedArbitration

https://t.co/zLv58xatMK

I had so much fun celebrating the new year and Orange County's flourishing Asian American population over the weekend! This year's T·∫øt Festival was a testament to how fortunate we are in O.C. to be enriched by one of largest Vietnamese communities in the United States. https://t.co/Bi31xiNRiH

Disasters fueled by climate change are ravaging California, but no single agency is responsible for analyzing their devastation and our resilience. Creating an independent board would help us better understand how we keep people safe moving forward.
https://t.co/2ulW92I8sj

Orange County is fortunate to be home to top-notch doctors, researchers, and institutions making breakthrough discoveries to end cancer as we know it. Last year, I had the pleasure of learning about the innovations taking place at @UCIrvineHealth directly. #WorldCancerDay https://t.co/Ws4abWgOQ9

Today, the House passed legislation to boost our global competitiveness, strengthen supply chains and U.S.-based manufacturing, and lower costs. I'm proud the America COMPETES Act includes several of my amendments to prioritize climate action in our approach to national security.

Government officials who abuse their positions for personal gain betray the trust of the American people and weaken our democracy. Banning Congressmembers from trading stocks is an essential step toward restoring faith in government.

https://t.co/NRrsbzZ1s5

Women in the workforce are integral to economic growth. Our global competitors are prioritizing smart family policies, like paid leave, affordable child care, and universal pre-k, because they're smart economic policies. The U.S. needs to catch up.

https://t.co/sWIhVe2pfG

The big banks make billions each year exploiting vulnerable families who can't make ends meet. This greed drives Americans toward predatory payday lenders. I'm glad the Biden Administration is taking action to better protect consumers.

https://t.co/oUuzyZpvvt

I voted for the bipartisan infrastructure law because it'll strengthen California's economy. Our team is working in concert with state and local leaders to secure meaningful investments in Orange County.

More on the resources available to our community ‚¨áÔ∏è
https://t.co/zCfoOHge5f

As we welcome the #YearOfTheTiger, I'm reflecting on how fortunate we are in Orange County to be enriched by one of the largest Asian American populations in the United States. This diversity is one of our greatest strengths.

Happy Lunar New Year to all who celebrate!

Social Security has been a lifeline for families ever since the first check was issued 82 years ago today. This vital program has helped millions retire with dignity and boosted local economies. We must protect future generations by strengthening Social Security.

Pollution from wildfires puts lives at risk by worsening asthma, prompting heart attacks, and exacerbating other health issues. We must take action against the climate crisis because it's intensifying California's wildfires and damaging our health.
https://t.co/NrqWwQm6ra

Being clear-eyed about the past, including its horrors, is necessary to creating a better future. I encouraged @UCIrvine to apply to host @HolocaustMuseum's traveling exhibition because our community knows how critical it is to learn from our history. #HolocaustRemembranceDay https://t.co/nYZz0TXHIj

Addressing our nuclear legacy in the Marshall Islands is key to renewing an important diplomatic agreement, so my @NRDems Subcommittee is conducting oversight. Our investigation has raised deep questions about the @StateDept and U.S. leadership in the Pacific. I want answers ‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/leCSjXwmRw

Canceling $50,000 of student loan debt is critical for our economic recovery. Nearly 90% of fully-employed borrowers say they're not financially secure enough to resume payments when the pause is lifted. That will hold our economy back and hurt all of us.

https://t.co/Ek4U9luYB6

Climate change is causing food shortages, unrest, and displacement around the world. We must make fighting this crisis a top priority in our security planning. I‚Äôm proud to co-lead a task force with @JimLangevin that‚Äôll spearhead solutions to do just that.
https://t.co/0fxoEbcgFL

Scam PACs make millions each year off of Americans, usually veterans and seniors, who thought they were participating in our democracy. Today, @RepMalinowski and I introduced legislation to crack down on these predatory groups. More ‚§µÔ∏è https://t.co/JJTwEAYC2z

Members of Congress should be working for the people, not for their stock portfolios. My colleagues and I are demanding House leadership bring legislation to the floor that bans congresspeople from owning or trading stocks while in office. https://t.co/2evJiHrZ3H
@Bridginne @DeathValleyNPS At many parks, it is a fee per vehicle. So the 4th grader with the pass gets everyone in for free. My daughter really liked being able to treat us all.

I'm fighting to strengthen Every Kid Outdoors because it teaches kids about public lands, helps families take affordable vacations, and boosts local economies. This program should be accessible to all. Learn more ‚¨áÔ∏è

https://t.co/QB7sDSbtLU
And because there's one in every family, I bring you... Paul ‚§µÔ∏è https://t.co/FGkHiSTsZk

Reminder to all families with fourth graders! It's not too late to sign up for Every Kid Outdoors, a wonderful program that lets fourth graders and their families into our national parks for free. Our family recently took advantage and visited @DeathValleyNPS. https://t.co/h23x2Ibpsj

It's difficult to think that my daughter's generation may not have the same freedoms as mine or my mother's. Reproductive justice is essential to social equity and an individual's economic security. The Senate must act by passing the Women's Health Protection Act. #RoeAnniversary

U.S. drone strikes have killed thousands of innocent civilians, including children and American citizens. The Biden Administration needs to recognize these broken approaches devastate communities, erode America's image abroad, and make us less safe. https://t.co/Dhoc8DpmBq

Taxpayers subsidize oil and gas drilling to the tune of $660 billion per year. Meanwhile, weather-related disasters intensified by climate change cost us billions each year to clean up.

It doesn't seem like propping up polluters is the wisest use of taxpayer dollars to me ü§î https://t.co/udGV7zrcTr

Per-unit prices usually go down when you buy in bulk‚Äîunless, apparently, taxpayers are paying. Internal documents from defense contractor TransDigm show the corporation is training staff to price-gouge the Pentagon. I demanded answers from TransDigm's Executive Chairman ‚¨á https://t.co/wqTyFQPciU

In an internal email, a salesperson for TransDigm‚Äîa defense contractor‚Äîbragged about "being full of B.S." but still making a deal that ripped off taxpayers. Today, I confronted TransDigm's Executive Chairman about the company's price gouging. His response? No comment. https://t.co/6uF0ONwL2Q

Medicare for All wouldn't just save lives; it would also decrease overall health care spending and save taxpayers ~$450 billion each year.

I'm looking forward to talking about this and more today with @Public_Citizen. RSVP ‚¨áÔ∏è
https://t.co/pXMIvOVHnl

Knowing if you have COVID is key to stopping its spread. Starting today‚Äîone day ahead of schedule‚Äîfamilies can order free at-home coronavirus tests via @USPS. Enter your address ‚¨áÔ∏è to get tests delivered straight to your door.
https://t.co/pFY0tAUhDS

The most meaningful tribute we can make to Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. is to secure voting rights for every American. Now is not just a time for reflection, but also for action. The House passed the Freedom to Vote Act last week; the Senate must show the same courage. #MLKDay

An all-electric school bus fleet would cut carbon emissions by 5+ million tons‚Äîall while saving districts up to 80% on fuel, maintenance, and repairs. I'm proud the bipartisan infrastructure law makes it easier for schools to use electric buses.
https://t.co/IFU3hASawA

Knowing if you have COVID-19 can help keep you, your family, and your community safe. That's why, back in March 2020, I pressed the former head of the CDC to make testing free for every American.

https://t.co/VC8dl9DJ1p

Congress passed laws mandating free COVID tests for all, but Americans are still getting billed. My colleagues and I are urging the Administration to expand federally-run testing sites, crack down on testing providers that fraudulently charge patients, and more ‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/STAQuPdyPm

Americans with chronic diseases have enough to worry about; they shouldn't also have to fear financial ruin. I'm proud my bill to make it easier to deduct medical expenses from federal taxes was signed into law, but we must do more to protect patients.
https://t.co/uaLklLjxTp

We're in the middle of a national blood shortage, but not everyone who can safely donate blood is allowed to. My colleagues and I are urging @US_FDA to end a discriminatory policy that prevents gay and bisexual men, as well as others in the LGBTQ+ community, from giving blood. https://t.co/fokoG0eyRd

The Internal Revenue Service has a backlog of ~6 million tax returns, including 2.7 million from 2020. @GerryConnolly and I are demanding the agency brief Congress by the end of the month on their plans to return these dollars to families, starting with the most vulnerable. https://t.co/cH4hW6V5ka

As we commemorate the arrival of the first Korean immigrants today, I'm thinking about how fortunate we are in Orange County to be enriched by one of the largest Korean communities in the United States. This diversity truly makes us stronger. #KoreanAmericanDay

Nearly 60% of the Afghan population are facing severe hunger and malnutrition this winter. I have been calling for humanitarian aid to help the millions struggling during this crisis. Yesterday's announcement is a welcome start by the Administration.
https://t.co/QQezmGD2Rv

Paid leave is good for our economy because it makes our workforce stronger and more stable. We know that some Americans will need to take time off to care for themselves or a loved one. With paid leave, we can prevent talent from leaving the workforce permanently. https://t.co/GyJbxxIp7a

Food insecurity has skyrocketed during the pandemic, including in Orange County. My son and I recently volunteered at @SecondHarvestFB's Harvest Solutions Farm, which is providing nutritious food to our community. In Congress, I'll keep fighting to lower the costs families face. https://t.co/ik5XWt1f4n

The Trump Administration started letting @CMSGov shift seniors on Medicare to plans managed by private entities‚Äîwithout their consent. Now, Wall Street-backed companies are lining up for the program. My colleagues and I are urging the Biden Administration to put an end to this. https://t.co/Ga0ROCt3BQ

The U.S. broke its record for daily COVID cases this week, but @OSHA_DOL‚Äîthe federal agency charged with keeping workers safe‚Äîwon't preserve its emergency protections for health care workers. For all of our sakes, OSHA needs to issue a strong, permanent standard. https://t.co/zbzEAB78a6

Orphan wells contaminate groundwater, emit a potent greenhouse gas, and leak toxins into the air. I‚Äôm glad the new infrastructure law helps states plug these wells, but we also need to crack down on oil companies for abandoning them in the first place.
https://t.co/aqdZJDIfCj

Respect for our elections, regardless of the results, is a bedrock principle of our system of government. Last year's violent storming of the Capitol cut at the heart of our democracy. There must be accountability so this assault never happens again.

Child care isn‚Äôt just about families; it‚Äôs also about our economy. Businesses rely on their workers, many of whom need quality, affordable child care in order to do their jobs. By investing in child care, we can make our economy stronger and more stable.
https://t.co/GS6lv5tJmy

As we celebrate the start of 2022, I'm reflecting on all that our team was able to accomplish last year in partnership with our community. I'm proud of the work we did, and I'm excited to share this report detailing what we achieved‚Äîtogether. Read it ‚§µÔ∏è
https://t.co/KKkIuRm1M5

Great news! As of this week, patients in need of emergency medical care no longer have to worry about surprise bills from doctors and hospitals outside their network. I proudly voted for this bipartisan bill, and I'm grateful it's now law.

https://t.co/RcbY0uQ7f8

Wishing everyone in California and across our country a happy and healthy new year! I'm honored to serve as a voice for Orange County families in Washington, and I can't wait to continue our work in #NewYear2022.

Climate change will devastate our economy if we don't take bold and urgent action. Weather and climate disasters already cost us billions of dollars each year, and that number is only slated to grow if we don't curb the climate crisis.

https://t.co/NhWC7w0J3n
Wishing a #MerryChristmas to everyone celebrating in Orange County and across the country! From my family to yours, I hope your holiday is filled with love and laughter.

Thank you, @POTUS, for upholding human rights and making the Uyghur Forced Labor Prevention Act the law of the land. This bipartisan bill will hold the People‚Äôs Republic of China accountable for its exploitation of forced labor in Xinjiang and its abuse of Muslim minorities.

Organ Procurement Organizations are often havens for waste, fraud, and abuse. Last year, @CongressmanRaja and I launched a formal investigation so Congress can hold these federal contractors accountable ‚§µÔ∏è
https://t.co/iXT2iAJOmS

Reports of gross mismanagement at Organ Procurement Organizations are not new‚Äîbut they're still devastating for the 100,000+ Americans in need of lifesaving transplants. It's clear @OversightDems needs to continue its investigation into this patient abuse.
https://t.co/DaeyNrPnyn

The #BuildBackBetter Act is fiscally responsible legislation.  There is a cost to not making child care more affordable, not reducing prescription drug prices, not investing in clean energy and green manufacturing, and not cracking down on wealthy tax cheats.

My full statement: https://t.co/c5l69uYilf

The federal government has a duty to protect our democracy‚Äîincluding every American's right to vote. We can do this by cracking down on gerrymandering, modernizing voter registration, reforming our broken campaign finance system, fighting election subversion, and more. https://t.co/pPTiOwnGj0

Before coming to Congress, I taught bankruptcy law at @UCIrvine. I now have the privilege of representing the school and many of its students, professors, and faculty in DC, so it was such a special treat to see a fellow Anteater testifying before @NRDems earlier this month! https://t.co/s5OH0MNNeg

A true public servant, @RepLowenthal has fought tirelessly for CA families for ~30 years. His passion will be missed in the halls of Congress, but I‚Äôm confident he will continue being a leading voice on the need for a stronger, greener, and more globally competitive economy. https://t.co/cycPeyXY4O

The bipartisan infrastructure law and the #BuildBackBetter Act are designed to strengthen our economy for years to come. Both of these investments create jobs‚Äîand help workers actually fill those jobs by making child care more affordable, lowering health care costs, and more. https://t.co/ndYyGsSpOy

Child care costs are skyrocketing, and that's a real problem for workers‚Äîand therefore, our entire economy. I used my whiteboard to show how the #BuildBackBetter Act lays the foundation for a strong economy, including through investments in child care üëá https://t.co/Gxe1GCeI2F

I recently chaired a @NRDems hearing on establishing a national Asian American Museum. I was taken by @LisaLing's testimony, which detailed some of the many contributions of Asian Americans to the U.S.‚Äîand showed how learning API history improves everyone's connection to America. https://t.co/i5CGbT9IOY

The Build Back Better agenda is good for California's economy. The infrastructure law invests in our ports, while the #BuildBackBetter Act prioritizes wildfire prevention‚Äîwhich is much cheaper than suffering the losses‚Äîand helps boost electric vehicle research and manufacturing. https://t.co/IiEidi7XEV

Americans have shorter lifespans and worse health outcomes than our peers in other developed countries‚Äîeven though we spend significantly more on health care. TOMORROW, I'm hosting a town hall on how I'm fighting to lower costs and improve care. RSVP ‚§µÔ∏è

https://t.co/nvrMSOkHx4

Lives are on the line. Congress needs to hold Big Pharma accountable by passing the #BuildBackBetter Act, which allows Medicare to negotiate drug prices, caps out-of-pocket costs for seniors, and recovers taxpayer dollars when companies jack up prices faster than inflation. (8/8)

We now have more evidence that research and development needs do not justify high drug prices. All of the drugs studied are priced significantly higher today than they were at launch.

In May, I confronted a Big Pharma CEO about this R&D myth üëá (7/8)

https://t.co/c9NUVG1iak

Big Pharma doesn‚Äôt just weaponize patient assistance programs to squash competition. See our office's report on how pharmaceutical giants gobble up small companies that would otherwise make them compete‚Äîand reduce their prices ‚§µÔ∏è (6/8)

https://t.co/DnuZtLrOWb

Here‚Äôs the kicker: Big Pharma spends far less on these programs compared to total revenue. They provide support long enough for patients to start depending on a drug, but not long enough to be a sustainable solution‚Äîthen they write off these donations to cheat the tax code. (5/8)

I'm laser-focused on the findings that show drug companies use patient assistance programs as public relations tools to undercut competition. Big Pharma hooks Americans on drugs right as their exclusivity is ending, so patients won‚Äôt seek out more affordable treatments. (4/8)

Internal documents show that Big Pharma is specifically targeting the U.S. market because Medicare can‚Äôt negotiate. Taxpayers lost more than $25 billion over a 5 year period because of this policy.

It's fiscally irresponsible not to let Medicare negotiate drug prices. (3/8)

Price gouging hurts both patients and taxpayers. The report found that Big Pharma jacked up the prices of 12 drugs 250x over the past several years. Taxpayers are footing that multi-billion-dollar bill through Medicare, which can‚Äôt even negotiate how much it has to pay. (2/8)

Yesterday, @OversightDems published its final staff report into Big Pharma's price gouging. The findings are egregious‚Äîbut they‚Äôre not surprising. Drug manufacturers have long prioritized their profits over the physical and financial health of families. (THREAD ‚¨áÔ∏è)

Government can and must help solve problems, but Congress has a responsibility to verify taxpayer dollars are being used wisely and as intended. There's no exception to the need for oversight of taxpayer money just because it's going towards defense. https://t.co/iAMH2xnVFr

Have you ever denied an app from sharing your personal data? Some app developers are doing it anyway. @RepRaskin and I are urging @FTC and @FCC to crack down on companies that collect and sell sensitive user data, including geolocation and identifying information, for profit ‚¨áÔ∏è https://t.co/gPycjOKZnD

I opposed the 2022 National Defense Authorization Act because I refuse to rubber stamp waste, fraud, and abuse at any level of government‚Äîincluding at the Pentagon.

My full statement: https://t.co/McNt90jPP9

Foreign special interests shouldn't get a say in our elections, including at the state and local level. Today, I urged my colleagues to safeguard national security by passing the #ProtectingOurDemocracy Act, which includes my bill to ban foreign contributions to ballot measures. https://t.co/I3mLKOSU1m

I've been calling for stronger oversight of cloud service providers for years. Learn more about my push ‚§µÔ∏è

https://t.co/NWm4hwjWGs

System failures like these threaten the stability of our economy. Amazon Web Services controls 33% of the cloud services market‚Äîand all banks use the cloud. We need more federal oversight of cloud service providers to keep our financial systems secure.

https://t.co/S4Nn2b1unD

Unaffordable child care is a huge problem for our economy. Parents are leaving their jobs due to the lack of child care options, which is making our workforce less stable‚Äîfor all of us. The #BuildBackBetter Act's child care investments will strengthen our economy. https://t.co/2lUG306NfF

The #BuildBackBetter Act makes critical investments in child care, health care, clean energy, tax fairness, and cybersecurity‚Äîall of which will grow our economy for years to come.

WATCH me break down the #BuildBackBetter Act with my whiteboard ‚§µÔ∏è

https://t.co/T96VV9Y0GL

ICYMI: Last week, I used my whiteboard to explain how the #BuildBackBetter Act will make our economy stronger. I broke down key components of the bill and then took questions about how this legislation helps every single American. https://t.co/KCoGA0FQx2

Being in conversation with our community is an essential part of being a Representative. TOMORROW, I'm hosting a telephone town hall to hear directly from Orange County families, share my recent work, and take questions.

Join us tomorrow by dialing (855) 962-1016 at 5:30 PM PT! https://t.co/rSp9KaSTSF

Families shouldn‚Äôt go bankrupt paying for health care, especially when big insurers and Big Pharma are raking in massive profits. Medicare for All saves lives, reduces costs, and improves coverage for everyone.

I‚Äôm excited to talk about this and more next week. Details ‚§µÔ∏è https://t.co/ybfGXWpT8U

Back in January, I rewrote the House's disclosure rules so the American people could have more confidence in our hearings.

https://t.co/m3LxLMz5ZZ

Congress needs to be able to trust the answers we get in hearings. I noticed an energy consultant didn't disclose any potential conflicts of interest for a hearing on oil drilling, which‚Äîby the nature of his job‚Äîseemed off to me. I called him out for skirting disclosure rules ‚§µÔ∏è https://t.co/EoeEw0qJaq

Earlier this year, I introduced legislation to finally raise fees on polluters extracting from public lands. Learn more about how Big Oil takes advantage of taxpayers‚Äîto the tune of $1+ billion each year‚Äîbelow üëá

https://t.co/Os32OoIw0O

Polluters have been paying the same royalty rate to drill on federal public lands for *100* years. Oil- and gas-producing states don't even give Big Oil that sweetheart deal!

I've been fighting to get taxpayers a fair return, and I'm glad the Administration is echoing this call. https://t.co/P3oIPzIEZ8

In a hearing yesterday, I listened to a witness argue against telework for federal employees, while he was *checks Zoom* teleworking from his living room ü§î

Reminder: telework can attract and retain talent, reduce costs, and improve productivity, including at the federal level. https://t.co/b04I5LbpQt
Happening in 15 minutes! ‚§µÔ∏è https://t.co/cnzbwOpqU7

Refusing to address our nuclear legacy in the Marshall Islands is a choice, it's morally wrong, it violates our international agreements, and it puts our national security at risk.

I will continue to urge my colleagues to right this historic injustice.

https://t.co/aI06cDcKMz

In the '80s, the U.S. settled claims that our nuclear tests hurt the Marshallese, and we left the door open to future restitution, if needed.

Now we're saying that settlement was "final," breaking our agreements and threatening our national security.

https://t.co/j7ffynejbL
Mississippi's assault on reproductive freedom is a direct threat to gender, racial, and social equality. Americans simply cannot have economic security without bodily autonomy. #AbortionIsEssential

I'll be keeping a close eye on the comment section of this Wednesday's Instagram Live on the #BuildBackBetter Act. If you can't make it‚Äîor if you just want to submit your questions in advance‚Äîfill out this Google form ‚§µÔ∏è
https://t.co/MyJpZLulbh
